info.description: The Payment API is used to perform payment transactions to different types of accounts such as a domestic account or an international account. Payment API allows you to transfer, edit, or delete the transactions that occur within your own bank, other domestic banks, or international banks. Payment APIs leverage the Payment order microservice to perform the transactions.
info.title: PaymentAPI

post.summary: This API is used to perform a transaction between a domestic bank account and an international bank account. This allows customer to perform an international transaction.
This API is used to perform a transaction between two bank accounts that belong to the same branch.

This API is used to delete an internal transaction that has occurred between accounts that belong to two or more branches of the same bank. This API alllows the customer to delete the transaction that he/she has made to an account that belongs to another branch of the same bank located in different region.

This API is used to perfrom an external transaction between accounts that belong to two or more branches of the same bank. This allows customer to transfer amount to a branch of the bank that is located in another region or locality.
This API is used to delete the transaction that has occurred between a domestic bank account and an international bank account.
This API is used to perfrom an external transaction between accounts that belong to two different banks. This allows customer to transfer amount to other bank accounts.

This API is used to edit a transaction that has occurred between two or more accounts that belong to the same bank branch. This allows customers to edit a transcation that has occurred to his own accounts.
This API is used to create multiple domestic transactions at the same time. This allows customer to transfer amount to multiple accounts at once

This API is used to edit the internal transaction that has occurred between accounts that belong to two or more branches of the same bank. This allows customers to edit his/her transactions to other branches of the same bank located in a different region.
This API is used to delete the transaction that has occurred between accounts that belong to two or more branches of the same bank.
This API is used to edit a transaction that has occurred between a domestic account and an international account. This allows customers to edit any international transaction.
This API is used to delete the transaction that has occurred between two accounts that belong to the same bank.

This API is used to edit the external transaction that has occurred between accounts that belong to two different banks. This allows customers to edit a transcation that he has performed with a beneficiary who belongs to another bank.

This API fetches all the recipient accounts with pagination. Pagination allows you to display only a fixed set of records at a given point of time and provides you an option such as a button to click and view the complete set of records. This improves the application performance with faster data loading and less number of application crashes as the entire data need not be fetched at once.
This API is used to delete a recipient from your list of beneficiaries. In the Infinity base application, this API is used in the  Transaction module.
This API is used to edit the recipient details such as account number, name, phone number or so on. In the Infinity base application, this API is used in the  Transaction module.
This API is used to create/add a new recipient to the list of beneficiaries. In the Infinity base application, this API is used in the  Transaction module.

Transaction_id.description: Specifies the unique ID of each transaction performed by the customer

opstatus.description: Specifies the status of the operation (Success/Failure).

amount.description: Specifies the amount that is to be transferred to other accounts

frequencyEndDate.description: Specifies the date at which the messages must be stopped. (This parameter is valid only when frequencyType has been provided)

frequencyType.description: Specifies the frequency at which the payment transfers must be made. The transfers can be made on a daily, weekly, or on a monthly basis.

fromAccountNumber.description: Specifies the Account Number from which the amount must be debited.

isScheduled.description: Specifies whether the transfer is a scheduled transfer or a normal transfer.

scheduledDate.description: Specifies the date on which the scheduled transfer payment must occur (This parameter is valid only if the isScheduled parameter is set to true)

toAccountNumber.description: Specifies the account number to which the amount must be credited.

transactionsNotes.description: Specifies additional information about the transaction.

transactionType.description: Specifies whether the transaction type is an internal transfer, an external transfer, or an international transfer.

transactionCurrency.description: Specifies the currency type of the transaction, such as USD, Euro, or Pound.

MFAAttributes.description: Specifies the attributes for Multi-Factor Authentication

serviceName.description: Specifies the name of the Quantum Fabric service.

fromAccountCurrency.description: Specifies the currency of account from which the amount must be debited.

toAccountCurrency.description: Specifies the currency of the account to which the amount must be credited.

numberOfRecurrences.description: Specifies the number of times the transaction should execute (This parameter is valid only when frequencyType has been provided).

p2pContact.description: Specifies the Person to Person Contact details

deliverBy.description: Specifies the date by which the amount must be delivered

zipCode.description: Specifies the zip code of the customer

billerId.description: Specifies the unique ID of the biller

billid.description: Specifies the unique ID of the generated bill

payeeId.description: Specifies the unique ID of the Payee

payeeAccountNumber.description: Specifies the account number of the payee

payeeAddressLine1.description: Specifies the first line of the payee's address

payeeName.description: Specifies the name of the payee

payeeNickName.description: Specifies the nickname of the payee

payeeCurrency.description: Specifies the currency used by the payee to perform the transaction

wireAccountType.description: Specifies the type of wire account

cityName.description: Specifies the name of the city

swiftCode.description: Specifies the swift code for international transactions

country.description: Specifies the name of the country

internationalRoutingCode.description: Specifies the international routing number of the customer

frequencyStartDate.description: Specifies the date on which messages must start being sent. (This parameter is valid only when frequencyType has been provided)

referenceId.description: Specifies a unique refernce ID of the transaction for the customer

initiationId.description: Specifies the unique ID required for the initiation
